trans-unit.source: Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Run a MapReduce word count example on a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight. The program, written in Java, counts word occurrences in a text file.
trans-unit.target: Run a MapReduce word count example on a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight. The program, written in Java, counts word occurrences in a text file.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to run a MapReduce word count example on a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to run a MapReduce word count example on a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: The program is written in Java.
trans-unit.target: The program is written in Java.

trans-unit.source: It counts word occurrences in a text file, and then outputs a new text file that contains each word paired with its frequency of occurrence.
trans-unit.target: It counts word occurrences in a text file, and then outputs a new text file that contains each word paired with its frequency of occurrence.

trans-unit.source: The text file analyzed in this sample is the Project Gutenberg eBook edition of The Notebooks of Leonardo Da Vinci.
trans-unit.target: The text file analyzed in this sample is the Project Gutenberg eBook edition of The Notebooks of Leonardo Da Vinci.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document require a Windows client.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document require a Windows client.

trans-unit.source: For steps on using the word count example from a Linux, OS X, or Unix client, with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see <linkText>Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight with SSH</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For steps on using the word count example from a Linux, OS X, or Unix client, with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see <linkText>Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight with SSH</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure PowerShell to run a MapReduce program on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure PowerShell to run a MapReduce program on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: How to write MapReduce programs in Java.
trans-unit.target: How to write MapReduce programs in Java.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions about the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To submit the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To submit the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:
trans-unit.target: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create a MapReduce job definition:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create a MapReduce job definition:

trans-unit.source: hadoop-examples.jar comes with HDInsight version 2.1 clusters.
trans-unit.target: hadoop-examples.jar comes with HDInsight version 2.1 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The file was renamed hadoop-mapreduce.jar on HDInsight version 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: The file was renamed hadoop-mapreduce.jar on HDInsight version 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar file comes with the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar file comes with the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: There are two arguments for the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: There are two arguments for the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: The first one is the source file name, and the second is the output file path.
trans-unit.target: The first one is the source file name, and the second is the output file path.

trans-unit.source: The source file comes with the HDInsight cluster, and the output file path will be created at run time.
trans-unit.target: The source file comes with the HDInsight cluster, and the output file path will be created at run time.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to submit the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to submit the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name for where you want to run the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name for where you want to run the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to check for errors with running the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to check for errors with running the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the results of the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the results of the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShellconsole.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShellconsole.

trans-unit.source: Set the three variables in the following commands, and then run them:
trans-unit.target: Set the three variables in the following commands, and then run them:

trans-unit.source: The Azure Storage account is the one you created earlier in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Storage account is the one you created earlier in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is used to host the blob that is used as the default HDInsight cluster file system.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is used to host the blob that is used as the default HDInsight cluster file system.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Blob storage container name usually shares the same name as the HDInsight cluster, unless you specify a different name when you provision the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Blob storage container name usually shares the same name as the HDInsight cluster, unless you specify a different name when you provision the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to create an Azure storage context object:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to create an Azure storage context object:

trans-unit.source: Select-AzureSubscription is used to set the current subscription if you have multiple subscriptions, and the default subscription is not the one you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select-AzureSubscription is used to set the current subscription if you have multiple subscriptions, and the default subscription is not the one you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to download the MapReduce job output from the blob to the workstation:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to download the MapReduce job output from the blob to the workstation:

trans-unit.source: The /example/data/WordCountOutput folder is the output folder specified when you run the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: The /example/data/WordCountOutput folder is the output folder specified when you run the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: part-r-00000 is the default file name for MapReduce job output.
trans-unit.target: part-r-00000 is the default file name for MapReduce job output.

trans-unit.source: The file will be downloaded to the same folder structure in the local folder.
trans-unit.target: The file will be downloaded to the same folder structure in the local folder.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following screenshot, the current folder is the C root folder.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following screenshot, the current folder is the C root folder.

trans-unit.source: The file will be downloaded to the C:\example\data\WordCountOutput folder.
trans-unit.target: The file will be downloaded to the C:\example\data\WordCountOutput folder.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to print the MapReduce job output file:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to print the MapReduce job output file:

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job produces a file named part-r-00000, which contains words and the counts.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job produces a file named part-r-00000, which contains words and the counts.

trans-unit.source: The script uses the findstr command to list all of the words that contains "there".
trans-unit.target: The script uses the findstr command to list all of the words that contains "there".

trans-unit.source: The output from the WordCount script should appear in the command window:
trans-unit.target: The output from the WordCount script should appear in the command window:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Word frequency results in PowerShell from the Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Word frequency results in PowerShell from the Hadoop MapReduce word count example in HDInsight.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that the output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.
trans-unit.target: Note that the output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.

trans-unit.source: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.
trans-unit.target: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you have seen how to run a MapReduce program that counts word occurrences in a text file with HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you have seen how to run a MapReduce program that counts word occurrences in a text file with HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell.
